root.name: colorMode()
root.description: Changes the way Processing interprets color data. By default, the parameters for fill(), stroke(), background(), and color() are defined by values between 0 and 255 using the RGB color model. The colorMode() function is used to change the numerical range used for specifying colors and to switch color systems. For example, calling colorMode(RGB, 1.0) will specify that values are specified between 0 and 1. The limits for defining colors are altered by setting the parameters max, max1, max2, max3, and maxA.
root.syntax: colorMode(mode) colorMode(mode, max) colorMode(mode, max1, max2, max3) colorMode(mode, max1, max2, max3, maxA)

parameter.label: mode
parameter.description: int: Either RGB or HSB, corresponding to Red/Green/Blue and Hue/Saturation/Brightness

parameter.label: max
parameter.description: float: range for the red or hue depending on the current color mode

parameter.label: max1
parameter.description: float: range for the red or hue depending on the current color mode

parameter.label: max2
parameter.description: float: range for the green or saturation depending on the current color mode

parameter.label: max3
parameter.description: float: range for the blue or brightness depending on the current color mode
